data.enText: to officially take sth away from sb, especially as a punishment

data.chText: 他们的土地在战后被没收。
data.enText: Their land was confiscated after the war.

data.chText: 老师警告说，如果他们上课时继续使用手机就予以没收。
data.enText: The teacher threatened to confiscate their phones if they kept using them in class.

simple_means.memory_skill: con 共同 + fisc 钱包，引申为“国库” + ate 使… → 都放到国库里 → 充公

tr: take temporary possession of as a security, by legal authority
example: The customs agents impounded the illegal shipment
The police confiscated the stolen artwork

value.def: If you confiscate something from someone, you take it away from them, usually as a punishment.

example.ex: There is concern that police use the law to confiscate assets from people who have committed minor offences...
example.tran: 有人担心警方利用该法罚没犯下轻罪的人的财产。

example.ex: They confiscated weapons, ammunition and propaganda material.
example.tran: 他们没收了武器、弹药和宣传材料。

example.ex: The new laws allow the confiscation of assets purchased with proceeds of the drugs trade.
example.tran: 新的法律允许没收用毒品交易所获收益购置的资产。

rootsaffixes.indicate: = purse 钱包 , 引申为“国库”
rootsaffixes.title: fisc

partsOfSpeech.dec: con 共同 + fisc 钱包，引申为“国库” + ate 做，造成，使… → 都放到国库里 → 充公
confiscat〔e〕充公 + ion 表名词 → 没收
fisc 钱包，引申为“国库” + al …的 → 财政的
